title: Sea-Fisheries and Maritime Jurisdiction Act 2006 (No. 8 of 2006) and the SeaFisheries, Foreshore and Dumping at Sea (Transfer of Departmental
heading: 1. These Regulations may be cited as the Sea-Fisheries (Quotas)
text_raw:
1. These Regulations may be cited as the Sea-Fisheries (Quotas) 

Regulations 2021.

title: Sea-Fisheries and Maritime Jurisdiction Act 2006 (No. 8 of 2006) and the SeaFisheries, Foreshore and Dumping at Sea (Transfer of Departmental
heading: 2. (1) In these Regulations “Quota Regulation” means Council Regulation
text_raw:
2. (1) In these Regulations “Quota Regulation” means Council Regulation 

(EU) 2021/92. 

(2) A word or expression that is used in the Quota Regulation and is also 
used in these Regulations, has, unless the context otherwise requires, the same 
meaning in these Regulations as it has in the Quota Regulation.
text_norm: 2 (1) regulation quota regulation mean council regulation (eu) 2021 92 (2) word expression used quota regulation also used regulation unless context otherwise requires meaning regulation quota regulation

title: Sea-Fisheries and Maritime Jurisdiction Act 2006 (No. 8 of 2006) and the SeaFisheries, Foreshore and Dumping at Sea (Transfer of Departmental
heading: 3. The master of -
text_raw:
3. The master of - 

(a) 

(b) 

an Irish sea-fishing boat wherever it may be, or 

a sea-fishing boat in the exclusive fishing limits of the State 

shall comply with Articles 8, 12, 14, 15, 16, 17, 18, 19, 20, 24, 27, 29, 32, 33, 
34, 37, 38, 39, 41(1) and (2), 42, 43, 44, 45, 48, 49, 50 and 57 of the Quota 
Regulation.
text_norm: 3 master - (a) (b) irish sea-fishing boat wherever may sea-fishing boat exclusive fishing limit state shall comply article 8 12 14 15 16 17 18 19 20 24 27 29 32 33 34 37 38 39 41(1) (2) 42 43 44 45 48 49 50 57 quota regulation

title: Sea-Fisheries and Maritime Jurisdiction Act 2006 (No. 8 of 2006) and the SeaFisheries, Foreshore and Dumping at Sea (Transfer of Departmental
heading: 4. (1) Subject to paragraph (2), the master of -
text_raw:
4. (1) Subject to paragraph (2), the master of - 

(a) 

(b) 

an Irish sea-fishing boat wherever it may be, or 

a sea-fishing boat in the exclusive fishing limits of the State 

shall comply with Article 11(1), (2) and (3) of the Quota Regulation in relation 
to sea bass. 

(2) The master of an Irish sea-fishing boat operating in ICES Sub-area 6 or 
ICES Sub-area 7 is subject to the Bass (Conservation of Stocks) Regulations 
2006 (S.I. No. 230 of 2006) in relation to sea bass. 

1 OJ L 31, 29.1.2021, p.31 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 19th February, 2021. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [69] 3 

(3) A person engaged in recreational fisheries that is fishing for sea bass 

shall comply with Article 11(5) and (6) of the Quota Regulation. 

5 An operator (as defined in Article 4 of Council Regulation (EC) 
1224/2009 of 20 November 20092) shall comply with Article 41(3) of the 
Quota Regulation.

title: Sea-Fisheries and Maritime Jurisdiction Act 2006 (No. 8 of 2006) and the SeaFisheries, Foreshore and Dumping at Sea (Transfer of Departmental
heading: 6. The Sea-Fisheries (Quotas) Regulations 2020 (S.I. No. 57 of 2020) are
text_raw:
6. The Sea-Fisheries (Quotas) Regulations 2020 (S.I. No. 57 of 2020) are 

revoked. 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

11 February, 2021. 

CHARLIE MCCONALOGUE, 

Minister for Agriculture, Food and the Marine. 

2 OJ L 343, 22.12.2009 p.1

title: Sea-Fisheries and Maritime Jurisdiction Act 2006 (No. 8 of 2006) and the SeaFisheries, Foreshore and Dumping at Sea (Transfer of Departmental
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

These Regulations have the purpose of giving effect to the provisions of 
Council Regulation (EU) 2021/92 fixing for 2021 the fishing opportunities for 
certain fish stocks and groups of fish stocks, applicable in Union waters and, 
for Union fishing vessels, in certain non-Union waters. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 [69] 5
